content: The "Small Business Procurement Improvement Act of 2012" aims to increase small business participation in multiple award contracts. The Small Business Act is being amended to include small business concerns in multiple award contracts to a greater extent. The Small Business Act is being amended to include small business concerns in set-aside programs and agency outreach efforts. The Administrator, in consultation with the Administrator of the Office of Federal Procurement Policy and any agency that obtains 5 percent of procurement requirements through a multiple award contract, shall carry out a program to increase the participation of small business concerns in multiple award contracts. This program aims to increase awareness and provide education and training on Federal agency procedures for the bid and award of multiple award contracting procedures. The program aims to increase small business participation in multiple award contracting procedures by assisting them in getting listed on contracts and tracking their participation. DEFINITIONS. Section 3 of the Small Business Act is amended to include contracts under the Federal Supply Schedule program and multi-agency contracts for government agencies to obtain supplies and services. The Small Business Act is amended to include contracts under the Federal Supply Schedule program and multi-agency contracts for obtaining supplies and services. It also defines the term 'blanket purchase agreement' as per specific regulations. The Small Business Act is amended to include contracts under the Federal Supply Schedule program and multi-agency contracts for obtaining supplies and services. It also defines the term 'blanket purchase agreement' as per specific regulations. Additionally, the term 'basic ordering agreement' is defined in section 16.703 of title 48, Code of Federal Regulations. SEC. 4. Ensuring small business participation in various government contracts. Section 15(g)(1) of the Small Business Act is amended to require the President to annually establish Government-wide goals for task orders and delivery orders placed against contracts awarded to small businesses. The Small Business Act is amended to establish Government-wide goals for task orders and delivery orders placed against contracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans, qualified HUBZone small businesses, socially and economically disadvantaged individuals, and women. SEC. 5. IMPROVEMENTS TO THE SMALL BUSINESS RESERVE. Section 15(j) of the Small Business Act is amended to increase the amount from $100,000 to $200,000 and to include applicability to task or delivery orders placed against multiple award contracts, including those under the Federal Supply Schedule program. The Administrator, in consultation with the Administrator of General Services Administration, shall ensure this subsection applies accordingly. The Administrator of General Services Administration must issue regulations within 120 days of enactment of this Act regarding the correct size standard for task orders, implementation of the non-manufacturer rule, and limitation on subcontracting provisions. The Administrator of General Services Administration will ensure subcontracting provisions at the task order level and display correct size information for small businesses in electronic ordering systems. SEC. 6. SMALL BUSINESS REPRESENTATION ON THE FEDERAL ACQUISITION REGULATORY COUNCIL. Amendment to Section 1302(b)(1) of title 41, United States Code includes adding the Administrator of the Small Business Administration. In cases of equal votes among council members, the Administrator of the Office of Federal Procurement Policy will have the deciding vote.
